August 12 at 6:43 PM ·

JJHS Back to School Registration and Chromebook Pick-up

August 13th and 14th from 9:00 AM to 2:00 PM

Parents will need to enter the 7/8 parent pick-up area and go to the library through the double-doors. There you will be able to do the following:

Pick up your child's registration packet.

Fill out the Chromebook checkout forms.

Receive your child's Chromebook device.

Pick up textbooks for remote learners only (face-to-face learners will receive theirs in class).

Once you have these things, please exit the parent pick-up area and proceed to the front parking lot to fill out the registration forms.

Once you have filled these out, you can return them to the front desk secretary. If you are unable to complete the forms on campus, please send them with your child on Monday morning.

A parent or guardian must be present to sign out the Chromebook, unless you have made prior arrangements with the JISD Technology Department or the JJHS Administrators

post_text: The JHS Cheerleaders are bringing the tradition back with the 2019 Mini-Clinic. The camp is July 15th through July 19th from 8 AM to 12 PM at the JHS Gym. Camp is open to any child ages 3 (if potty-trained) through 6th grade. They will learn motions, jumps, cheers, chants, a dance, and basic stunting. The cost is $60 per child and $50 for each additional child in the same household. This cost includes a T-shirt along with a snack/drink each day at camp. Registration at the door is $70.

post_text: Jefferson Masonic Lodge #38 recently provided toothbrush kits for First Grade Students at Jefferson Elementary School. This service is a part of the Fantastic Teeth Fan Club from the Masonic Home and School of Texas. JES Nurse Brandy Music and Jefferson High School students Caitlyn Sharp and Alexus Thomason reminded students how important it is to take care of their "fantastic teeth." Toothbrush kits contain a toothbrush, toothpaste, dental floss and a 2-minute timer. Pictured with First Graders are (L to R): Mr. Cotton Hampton, Brandy Musick, RN, Caitlyn Sharp, Alexus Thomason, Mr. Buddy Rich, and Mr. Harrold Mackey.
